document_data.released: Before [[1370 DR]]{{Cite organized play/RPGA/The Mad Mage's Revenge|3}}
document_data.mainbody: '''''The Meanderings Upon the Friezes of Hotun-Shûl''''' was a [[book]] penned by [[Skorm Caldril]] and translated by [[Triel (writer)|Triel]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] sometime before the late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.History: A copy of ''The Meanderings Upon the Friezes of Hotun-Shûl'' belonged to [[Manshoon XII]], a clone of [[Manshoon]], in the {{YearlinkName|1370}}. The book was stored in the [[mage]]'s library of mundane and [[arcane]] tomes in his lair in an abandoned temple of [[Amaunator]] underneath the [[Waterdeep/City of the Dead|City of the Dead]] of [[Waterdeep]].
